Text.Text: Your journey into the world of man-made horror begins here. Be aware of trespassing ghosts!
A crippled tree that is many hundreds of years old. A mysterious aura surrounds it after all members of an influential big industrialist family have met their deaths in the shadow of its crown.
Succumbing to the smog of the big city, these trees have been spookily decorated to make them at least somewhat respectable.
Some residents have taken on these trees to make them shine in the most beautiful splendour for the festival of horror.
Baked pumpkins, butterbeer and grilled sausages are distributed to hungry visitors here.
Candy canes, roasted almonds and pumpkin biscuits are distributed to the little visitors.
The steam of hot cider hits your nose. A pinch of cinnamon gives it a special aroma. Don't drink too much or you won't find your way home!

Gather around and enjoy seasonal dishes delivered by vampire waitresses and zombie waiters. Sometimes a visitor throws his knife into the bark of the tree in the middle of the tables. This splatters red tree sap onto the surrounding guests.
One day a child fell into the well and was never found again. Since then, the water of the well is undrinkable and anyone who gets too close to it is overcome by a cold shiver.

Old witches dance around the cauldron, thick poison slowly bubbles away and foul-smelling vapours rise into the night sky. Stay back or you will become the next ingredient in the potion of the living dead.
An old gnarled tree decorated for the coming Halloween celebration.

The pumpkin season has begun! After the harvest festival, the stalls are richly filled with autumn vegetables, decorations and plants. Ghostly red light spreads an air of mystery. Scarecrows in disguise give visitors a good scare, and tonight the biggest pumpkin in the country will be crowned.

Once upon a time, one of the local priests decided to enter the catacombs beneath this old church. He didn't return from the journey. Ever since, the church's backyard transformed more and more into a spooky, misty graveyard, and some people swear, they saw gravestones and crupts popping up out of nowhere. Nevertheless, some strange cultists have began praying in the church and stenches of blood could be seen at the doorstep. Better to not mess with those folks!
